message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only GC/MS is a confirmatory test for substance use. Polymerase chain reaction is used to detect genetic material, urine immunoassay is a screening test, and Western blot is used to detect specific proteins.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Gas chromatography/mass spectrometry (GC/MS) is widely used for drug testing as it can accurately identify specific drugs and their metabolites in urine, blood, and other body fluids. This would be the most appropriate test to confirm potential substance use in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A potential substance use can be confirmed through Gas chromatography/mass spectrometry (GC/MS) test, which is the most accurate and sensitive confirmatory test for drugs in urine. Polymerase chain reaction and Western blot are typically used for genetic testing and immunoassay is less accurate than GC/MS for drug confirmation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Gas chromatography / mass spectrometry (GC/MS) is the gold standard for confirmation of substance use. It can identify specific drugs and their metabolites in urine, blood, or hair samples. The other options are not specific enough for drug confirmation, and PCR and Western blot are more commonly used for genetic testing and protein analysis, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of injected conjunctiva and combative behavior suggest substance use. Among the options, only Gas chromatography / mass spectrometry (GC/MS) can confirm specific substances in the body. Polymerase chain reaction and Western blot are used for genetic analysis and protein detection, respectively, and urine immunoassay can only detect certain classes of drugs but not specific substances.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest potential substance use and GC/MS (gas chromatography/mass spectrometry) is the most accurate test for detecting drugs in the body. Polymerase chain reaction is used for detecting DNA and RNA. Urine immunoassay and Western blot are also used in drug testing but are less accurate than GC/MS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only Gas chromatography / mass spectrometry can detect a wide range of drugs and confirm potential substance use. Urine immunoassay may not be as accurate and reliable as GC/MS. Polymerase chain reaction is used in molecular biology to amplify and detect specific DNA sequences, and Western blot is a laboratory technique used to detect specific proteins in a sample.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The question suggests that the patient may have been under the influence of a substance at the time of the accident. Among the options, Gas chromatography / mass spectrometry (GC/MS) is the most accurate test for detecting the presence of drugs or their metabolites in the body. Polymerase chain reaction and Western blot are used for genetic testing and protein analysis respectively, and Urine immunoassay may not be as accurate as GC/MS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest potential substance use, and GC/MS is a confirmatory test that can detect a variety of drugs in urine, blood, or hair samples. Polymerase chain reaction is used to amplify DNA samples, while Western blot is used to detect specific proteins, neither of which can confirm substance use. Urine immunoassay can detect drugs, but it is not as specific as GC/MS.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. GC/MS is specifically used for identifying the presence of drugs in biological samples, such as urine, blood or hair. This is the most accurate test to confirm substance use in the patient. Polymerase chain reaction and Western blot are used for genetic and protein analysis, respectively. Urine immunoassay is a preliminary screening test but not as accurate as GC/MS.
